title: 110_s3468
content: The Act titled "Nursing and Allied Health Education Preservation Act of 2008" aims to preserve provider-operated nursing and allied health education programs. The Nursing and Allied Health Education Preservation Act of 2008 amends Section 1861(v) of the Social Security Act to protect provider-operated nursing and allied health education programs from being denied status based on organizational or structural changes, as long as the hospital or health system maintains substantial control over the program. The Nursing and Allied Health Education Preservation Act of 2008 protects provider-operated nursing and allied health education programs from denial based on organizational or structural changes, as long as the hospital or health system maintains substantial control over the program. Examples of such arrangements include students being concurrently enrolled in a college or university and the program entering into agreements with third parties for services. The Nursing and Allied Health Education Preservation Act of 2008 allows financial services for nursing or allied health education programs if the hospital retains control and complies with regulations set by state boards or accrediting bodies. The Nursing and Allied Health Education Preservation Act of 2008 allows financial support for nursing or allied health education programs if they meet specific requirements, including ownership by a hospital or health system, or a nonprofit college operated by a hospital or health system. The Nursing and Allied Health Education Preservation Act of 2008 allows financial support for nursing or allied health education programs owned by hospitals or health systems. The Secretary is limited in denying payment for approved educational activities under this act. The paragraph outlines requirements for hospitals to comply with recoupment or denial of payments for previous cost reporting years. It clarifies that certain provider-operated programs and pass-through reimbursements are not affected by these regulations. Section 4004(b) of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1990 outlines regulations regarding recoupment or denial of payments for previous cost reporting years. Certain provider-operated programs and pass-through reimbursements are not affected by these regulations.
